newsitem.title: POLAND: CU Polish unit lifts '96 net to PLN 24 mln.
newsitem.headline: CU Polish unit lifts '96 net to PLN 24 mln.

text.p: The Polish life insurance unit of Britain's Commercial Union Plc (CU) lifted net profit last year by 253 percent to 24 million zlotys, the firm said in a statement on Tuesday.
The firm's audited results showed a 171 percent rise in gross premiums last year, or 323.6 million zlotys.
Preliminary results had shown a gross premium rise of 168 percent to 320 million zlotys. The firm has said it expects about 500 million zlotys in gross premiums this year.
Commercial Union's 11.5 percent share of Poland's life insurance market trails only that of PZU Zycie SA, which has about 77 percent.
CU has said it will raise market share to between 12 and 13 percent this year.
Commercial Union Towarzystwo Ubezpieczen na Zycie Polska SA is 90-percent owned by British CU and 10-percent by Wielkopolski Bank Kredytowy SA (WBK).
